lexUnit.name: sign.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an object, quality, or event whose presence or occurrence indicates the probable presence, occurrence, or advent of something else

sentence.text: There are some signs that the market is itself seeking to bridge this gap between ownership and control .
In Britain , there are some early signs that lower interest rates and lower inflation are putting us back on course for growth .

Maybe it is a sign of age taking its toll , but sexual imagery does n't command much of my attention these days .
Particularly in the USA , but also in the UK , we can see the signs of a movement developing around the belief in the value of critical thinking .

How could he have missed the sign before ?

That was a good sign .
